Shizuru - Moderate Curse.description: Moderate Curse: Shizuru decrees that her light is no longer your ally. You gain@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{Light Blindness}.

Sivanah - Major Boon.name: Sivanah - Major Boon
Sivanah - Major Boon.description: Major Boon: You spread your illusions over a larger area. You can designate an area to permanently gain the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Hallucinatory Terrain}. All creatures within this area gain the effects of illusory disguise, changing their forms as you wish. You can designate a new area as a 1-minute activity, but doing so dismisses any previously designated areas.

Sivanah - Major Curse.name: Sivanah - Major Curse
Sivanah - Major Curse.description: Major Curse: Mirrors break whenever you cross their paths. You cannot be concealed by illusion magic of any kind (the spell automatically fails), and all creatures that see you know your true identity.

Sivanah - Minor Boon.name: Sivanah - Minor Boon
Sivanah - Minor Boon.description: Minor Boon: Sivanah prevents your enemies from pulling off your veil. Once, when a foe rolls a success on a Perception check to disbelieve your illusion, it gets a critical failure instead. Sivanah typically grants this benefit to protect an elaborate or consequential illusory deception, and she never uses it to improve the effect of a harmful illusion.

Sivanah - Minor Curse.name: Sivanah - Minor Curse
Sivanah - Minor Curse.description: Minor Curse: Your hair becomes a wild variety of colors, which cannot be altered with mundane or magical means, and it somehow grows out from under any cap, scarf, or other headwear intended to disguise it. You gain a -2 status penalty to Deception skill checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} anyone else.

Sivanah - Moderate Boon.name: Sivanah - Moderate Boon
Sivanah - Moderate Boon.description: Moderate Boon: You wear a veil of illusion wherever you go. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} at will as an innate divine spell.

Sivanah - Moderate Curse.name: Sivanah - Moderate Curse
Sivanah - Moderate Curse.description: Moderate Curse: Those who betray the secrets of others find their own secrets laid bare. Each person from whom you are keeping a secret immediately learns one of your secrets involving that person. This curse doesn't give away other people's secrets you are keeping, only your own.

Torag - Major Boon.name: Torag - Major Boon
Torag - Major Boon.description:
Major Boon Standing watch or guarding a location counts as resting for you, preventing you from being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} due to lack of rest as long as you stand watch for at least 6 hours a day.

You can recover your Focus Points (if you have them) by standing guard in addition to any other options you have available.

When on guard, you gain a +4 status bonus to Perception to notice ambushes and other dangers approaching.

As long as you are holding a shield, you are always Defending during exploration without needing to move at half your travel speed, and you can perform another exploration activity as well.

While you are using a shield, its Hardness increases by 5.

Torag - Major Curse.name: Torag - Major Curse
Torag - Major Curse.description: Major Curse You are forever cast out from your home. Members of your community have their attitudes towards you shift two steps worse, meaning those who used to be helpful are now indifferent, those who were friendly are now unfriendly, and all others are now hostile. This doesn't necessarily result in violence, but hostile community members generally seek your permanent exile.

Torag - Minor Boon.name: Torag - Minor Boon
Torag - Minor Boon.description:
Minor Boon (Single-Use) Torag repairs your equipment so you may continue your vigil.

Once, a shield, weapon, or other item you hold or are wearing recovers all of its Hit Points. The item's Hardness doubles for 1 minute.

Torag can grant this boon just as the item would have been destroyed, preventing the item's destruction.

Occasionally, he grants this boon to restore an item important to dwarven history that has already been fully destroyed.

Torag - Minor Curse.name: Torag - Minor Curse
Torag - Minor Curse.description: Minor Curse Shoddy artisanship makes itself known. Whenever an item you're using takes damage, it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.

Torag - Moderate Boon.name: Torag - Moderate Boon
Torag - Moderate Boon.description:
Moderate Boon You are counted as family among Torag and his followers.

You gain the effects of a single dwarf ancestry feat of Torag's choice, even if you are not a dwarf, as long as you maintain Torag's blessing.

Torag - Moderate Curse.name: Torag - Moderate Curse
Torag - Moderate Curse.description:
Moderate Curse You must prove your skills at a craft by providing your own equipment.

You gain item bonuses only from items you make yourself.

Tsukiyo - Major Boon.name: Tsukiyo - Major Boon
Tsukiyo - Major Boon.description: Major Boon: Tsukiyo shares some of his own nature and can lead a favored soul back along the same path he has walked. The next time you would die, you are instead instantly restored to full health and lose any negative conditions you have.

Tsukiyo - Major Curse.name: Tsukiyo - Major Curse
Tsukiyo - Major Curse.description: Major Curse: When Tsukiyo truly loses patience with someone, he forces them to experience the hardships of others firsthand. Whenever you touch another creature or another creature touches you, you immediately gain any negative curses, diseases, and conditions they are suffering. These effects spread to you even when you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} another creature or a creature Strikes you.

Tsukiyo - Minor Boon.name: Tsukiyo - Minor Boon
Tsukiyo - Minor Boon.description: Minor Boon: Tsukiyo's simplest show of gratitude is a gift of clarity. Once, when you roll a failure on a saving throw against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead. Tsukiyo typically grants this boon against a particularly consequential mental effect.

Tsukiyo - Minor Curse.name: Tsukiyo - Minor Curse
Tsukiyo - Minor Curse.description: Minor Curse: Those who offend Tsukiyo find that light actively shuns them. You lose any low-light vision or darkvision you have, and you treat all light levels as one step lower.

Tsukiyo - Moderate Boon.name: Tsukiyo - Moderate Boon
Tsukiyo - Moderate Boon.description: Moderate Boon: Tsukiyo watches over you and guards your sleep. You are guaranteed a peaceful night's rest no matter what conditions you are sleeping in. Even nightmare and similar abilities can't disrupt your sleep unless they come from a deity, artifact, or similarly powerful source.

Tsukiyo - Moderate Curse.name: Tsukiyo - Moderate Curse
Tsukiyo - Moderate Curse.description: Moderate Curse: If Tsukiyo is particularly offended by someone, they may find themselves lost in delusions of moonlight. When attempting to navigate or find something at night, if you roll a success or critical success on your Perception check, Survival check, or other check to do so, you get a failure instead.

Urgathoa - Major Boon.name: Urgathoa - Major Boon
Urgathoa - Major Boon.description:
Major Boon When you contract contagions, you experience fever dreams filled with insight.

Once afflicted with a disease, you gain the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qsNeG9KZpODSACMq]{Foresight} with yourself as the target until no longer afflicted with any disease.

Urgathoa - Major Curse.name: Urgathoa - Major Curse
Urgathoa - Major Curse.description:
Major Curse Urgathoa teaches you that pointless lives in slavery to death and morality are bound to end in tragedy.

You develop an incurable wasting disease that leaves you @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy} 2, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and unable to move except by @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Tj055UcNm6UEgtCg]{Crawling}. This disease never progresses further to kill you, but it passes to your friends and loved ones merely by sight, wasting them away unto death before your eyes and causing them to rise as undead to haunt you.

Urgathoa - Minor Boon.name: Urgathoa - Minor Boon
Urgathoa - Minor Boon.description: Minor Boon You feast on the spoils of life and death. You gain the benefits of the @Compendium[pf2e.heritages.gyoN45SVfRZwHMkk]{Irongut Goblin} heritage, regardless of your ancestry. If you already have this heritage, the circumstance bonus increases to +4.

Urgathoa - Minor Curse.name: Urgathoa - Minor Curse
Urgathoa - Minor Curse.description:
Minor Curse You must overindulge or partake in forbidden feasts before you find yourself even remotely sated.

You need to eat 20 times as much food as normal to avoid starvation, though you always feel hungry regardless of how much you eat.

If you dine on the flesh and blood of sapient creatures, you need to eat only the normal amount of such meals and your hunger abates.

Urgathoa - Moderate Boon.name: Urgathoa - Moderate Boon
Urgathoa - Moderate Boon.description: Moderate Boon Urgathoa blesses you as one of her children. You gain negative healing.

Urgathoa - Moderate Curse.name: Urgathoa - Moderate Curse
Urgathoa - Moderate Curse.description: Moderate Curse Urgathoa cuts you off from positive energy without granting you the blessing of undeath. You are harmed by positive effects and don't recover Hit Points from them, as if you were an undead or had negative healing, but you are still harmed by negative effects as normal.

Zon-Kuthon - Major Boon.name: Zon-Kuthon - Major Boon
Zon-Kuthon - Major Boon.description: Major Boon Shadows are deeper around you. @Compendium[pf2e.ancestryfeatures.HHVQDp61ehcpdiU8]{Darkvision} and greater darkvision cannot penetrate darkness within 60 feet of you, but you can see through it normally.

Zon-Kuthon - Major Curse.name: Zon-Kuthon - Major Curse
Zon-Kuthon - Major Curse.description:
Major Curse Zon-Kuthon steals away your joy, leaving you with only pain.

You lose that which you cherish the most forever, and lose the ability to feel joy. You can't gain benefits from emotion effects based on positive emotions.

If Zon-Kuthon feels you are ready to renounce, destroy, mutilate, or torture that which you once cherished most, he might return it to you to allow you to do so.

Zon-Kuthon - Minor Boon.name: Zon-Kuthon - Minor Boon
Zon-Kuthon - Minor Boon.description:
Minor Boon (Single-Use) The Midnight Lord turns your blood and pain into chains of midnight darkness to destroy your foes.

Once, for 1 minute, whenever you take slashing, piercing, or bleed damage, chains rip forth from your body, affecting creatures in a line from your position in the direction of the attack (or in the direction of your choice for bleed damage or if you deal the damage yourself) with the effect of a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Grim Tendrils} spell whose level is equal to half your level rounded up, and whose DC is your highest spell DC (or 10 + your level + your Wisdom modifier if you have no spell DC).

Zon-Kuthon - Minor Curse.name: Zon-Kuthon - Minor Curse
Zon-Kuthon - Minor Curse.description: Minor Curse You are surrounded by spectral chains that cause you to always be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} and that have the same effects as armor with the noisy trait.

Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Boon.name: Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Boon
Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Boon.description:
Moderate Boon (Daily) Each morning, during your daily preparations, scars gather into words on your flesh.

The scars function as a scroll of a divine spell of Zon-Kuthon's choosing.

After you use the scroll or receive magical healing, the boon fades for the day, though some or all of the scars might remain as a reminder.

Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Curse.name: Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Curse
Zon-Kuthon - Moderate Curse.description:
Moderate Curse You share the pain of others, and even minor wounds bring you incredible pain.

Whenever you see (or otherwise sense) a creature take damage, you take [[/r 1d6]] mental damage.

Whenever you take damage any other way than from the first part of this curse, you take [[/r 1d6]] mental damage from increased pain and are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Mental damage from this curse ignores any resistance you have to mental damage.
